India's fascination with jewellery dates back to 5,000 years ago in the Indus Valley. At that time, the country was the largest manufacturer and exporter of beads to the world. It was also home to diamonds, semi-precious stones and gold. In fact, for more than 2,000 years, India was the sole supplier of gemstones to the world.
